title: CVPR_2009_10_abs

sentences.text: We propose a novel probabilistic framework for learning visual models of 3D object categories by combining appearance information and geometric constraints .
Objects are represented as a coherent ensemble of parts that are consistent under 3D viewpoint transformations .
Each part is a collection of salient image features .
A generative framework is used for learning a model that captures the relative position of parts within each of the discretized viewpoints .
Contrary to most of the existing mixture of viewpoints models , our model establishes explicit correspondences of parts across different viewpoints of the object class .
Given a new image , detection and classification are achieved by determining the position and viewpoint of the model that maximize recognition scores of the candidate objects .
Our approach is among the first to propose a generative proba-bilistic framework for 3D object categorization .
We test our algorithm on the detection task and the viewpoint classification task by using '' car '' category from both the Savarese et al. 2007 and PASCAL VOC 2006 datasets .
We show promising results in both the detection and viewpoint classification tasks on these two challenging datasets .

summary: We propose a novel probabilistic framework for learning visual models of 3D object categories by combining appearance information and geometric constraints . Objects are represented as a coherent ensemble of parts that are consistent under 3D viewpoint transformations . Each part is a collection of salient image features . A generative framework is used for learning a model that captures the relative position of parts within each of the discretized viewpoints . Contrary to most of the existing mixture of viewpoints models , our model establishes explicit correspondences of parts across different viewpoints of the object class . Given a new image , detection and classification are achieved by determining the position and viewpoint of the model that maximize recognition scores of the candidate objects . Our approach is among the first to propose a generative proba-bilistic framework for 3D object categorization . We test our algorithm on the detection task and the viewpoint classification task by using '' car '' category from both the Savarese et al. 2007 and PASCAL VOC 2006 datasets . We show promising results in both the detection and viewpoint classification tasks on these two challenging datasets .

Predicate-by_combining.label: by combining
Predicate-by_combining.description: The predicate 'by combining' indicates a process of integrating or merging two or more entities (represented by the subject and object) to form a new whole, where the resulting entity embodies characteristics from each input. This integration can be seen as a unifying force that brings together distinct aspects or features.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To propose means to suggest or put forward an idea, plan, or solution as a potential option for consideration. The predicate 'propose' establishes a relationship between the subject and object by indicating that the subject is offering or presenting the object as a viable possibility.

Predicate-are_represented_as.label: are represented as
Predicate-are_represented_as.description: The predicate 'are represented as' indicates that the subject (in this case, Objects) can be understood or described through the object (a coherent ensemble of parts), suggesting a conceptual equivalence between them. This connection implies that the properties and characteristics of the subject are reflected in the description provided by the object.

Predicate-that_are_consistent_under.label: that are consistent under
Predicate-that_are_consistent_under.description: The predicate 'that are consistent under' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the properties or characteristics of the subject remain stable or unchanged when viewed from different perspectives, transformations, or interpretations. In other words, it suggests that the subject's essence or identity is preserved despite changes in how it is perceived or understood.

Predicate-is_a_collection_of.label: is a collection of
Predicate-is_a_collection_of.description: The predicate 'is a collection of' indicates that the subject represents a grouping or aggregation of entities, concepts, or characteristics described by the object. It implies a relationship where the subject is composed of multiple elements, which are collectively referred to as the object.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' establishes an equivalence or identity relationship between its subject and object. It indicates that the subject and object share a common characteristic, property, or nature, suggesting they are essentially the same thing.

Predicate-contrasts_with.label: contrasts with
Predicate-contrasts_with.description: The predicate 'contrasts with' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) has distinct characteristics or features that differ significantly from those of another entity (the object). This contrast can be based on various aspects such as perspective, approach, methodology, outcome, or other relevant criteria. The connection between the subject and object is characterized by an inherent opposition, distinction, or disparity.

Predicate-establishes_explicit_correspon.label: establishes explicit correspondences of parts across different viewpoints of the object class
Predicate-establishes_explicit_correspon.description: This predicate describes a process where the subject creates or identifies specific relationships between distinct components or aspects (parts) within an object class from different perspectives or viewpoints. The resulting correspondences enable a deeper understanding of the object's structure, properties, and behaviors across various contexts.

Predicate-test.label: test
Predicate-test.description: To test means to evaluate or examine something (typically an idea, a process, or a product) in order to determine its quality, effectiveness, or accuracy. The predicate 'test' connects the subject and object by indicating that the subject is performing some kind of evaluation on the object.

Predicate-show.label: show
Predicate-show.description: To indicate or demonstrate the existence of something, often in a way that reveals its nature, quality, or significance. The predicate 'show' connects the subject to an object by highlighting or revealing aspects about it.

Predicate-are_performed_on.label: are performed on
Predicate-are_performed_on.description: The predicate 'are performed on' indicates a relationship where an action or process (subject) is applied to or carried out with respect to some entity, data set, or context (object). This connection implies that the subject's purpose or function involves working with or manipulating the object in some way.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship where the subject employs or relies on the object to achieve some purpose, perform an action, or accomplish a task. It suggests that the subject utilizes the object as a means to an end.

Predicate-is_used_for_learning_a_model.label: is used for learning a model
Predicate-is_used_for_learning_a_model.description: The predicate 'is used for learning a model' indicates that the subject (a linguistic construct or system) serves as a means to acquire knowledge or understanding about a specific object, which represents a concept, idea, or representation. In this context, the subject is employed to gain insight into the object's characteristics, properties, or relationships.

Predicate-used.label: used
Predicate-used.description: The predicate 'used' indicates that the subject has been employed or applied to achieve some purpose or effect, resulting in the creation of the object. It suggests a causal relationship between the subject and the object, implying that the subject was instrumental in bringing about the existence or generation of the object.

Predicate-determining.label: determining
Predicate-determining.description: The predicate 'determining' indicates a causal or explanatory relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject plays a crucial role in shaping or influencing the outcome described by the object. In this sense, determining implies a process of discovery, inference, or decision-making that leads to the creation or refinement of the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept or category has a more general or overarching term that encompasses it. This relationship suggests a hierarchical organization, where the object represents a higher-level abstraction or classification that includes the subject as one of its subcategories.
